update.description:
Depends on [ign-rendering pull request 187](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/187/support-generating-point-cloud-data-in/diff)

Replaces pull request #80 - I branched from there but made many changes afterwards so the diff may get confusing if I target that branch.

Updated the depth and rgbd camera sensors to connect to the new point cloud event from ign-rendering’s DepthCamera. Point cloud data are now generated in the shaders and not on CPU.

Also added a rgbd camera integration test. In addition to checking that the values are valid, it also compares the new xyz data generated by the shaders against those manually converted from depth data to make sure they are consistent.

Here are performance profiling results done in subt in a tunnel environment with X3 Config 4 robot \(1 VGA RGBD camera\):

**Before:** Sensor::Update 17.57ms

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/2061576688-rgbd_before.png)
**After:** Sensor::Update 5.71ms

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/461834678-rgbd_after.png)
update.title: Update depth and rgbd camera sensor to output point cloud data generated by ign-rendering DepthCamera

content.raw: I think that data has color. I think the main confusion here is that now we have 2 sensor types which are very similar to each other. Gazebo 9 / gazebo_ros_pkgs didn't have an RGBD camera.
content.html: I think that data has color. I think the main confusion here is that now we have 2 sensor types which are very similar to each other. Gazebo 9 / gazebo_ros_pkgs didn't have an RGBD camera.

content.raw: hmm looking at [GazeoRosDepthCamera](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/kinetic-devel/gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_ros_depth_camera.cpp#L421), it’s also packing rgb data but I’m not sure if the values are valid or not.
content.html: hmm looking at GazeoRosDepthCamera, it’s also packing rgb data but I’m not sure if the values are valid or not.

content.raw:
![grey_pc.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/2620958754-grey_pc.png)

The point cloud looks good to me now. So we're going with the greyscale RGB data instead of no RGB. I think that's ok, but we're just sending more data than needed, because the greyscale RGB values are redundant.
content.html: The point cloud looks good to me now. So we're going with the greyscale RGB data instead of no RGB. I think that's ok, but we're just sending more data than needed, because the greyscale RGB values are redundant.

pullrequest.title: Update depth and rgbd camera sensor to output point cloud data generated by ign-rendering DepthCamera

content.raw:
It looks like there's been a regression somewhere. The point cloud used to [look good](https://github.com/osrf/ros1_ign/pull/39) to me with the ROS 1 bridge, but now it's all over the place. Does it look good to you, @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} ?

![pt_cloud.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/3114591110-pt_cloud.png)
content.html: It looks like there's been a regression somewhere. The point cloud used to look good to me with the ROS 1 bridge, but now it's all over the place. Does it look good to you, @Ian Chen ?

I'm just trying to understand the difference between the 2 sensors. Is it something like

Data | Depth | RGBD
-- | -- | --
RGB image | no | yes
Depth image | yes | yes
Point cloud | yes, flat color? | yes, with color

I'm just trying to understand the difference between the 2 sensors. Is it something like

Data Depth RGBD
RGB image no yes
Depth image yes yes

pullrequest.title: Update depth and rgbd camera sensor to output point cloud data generated by ign-rendering DepthCamera

content.raw:
ha ya initially I manually converted depth data to gray scale image inside ign-sensors  `DepthCameraSensor` but reverted it to just use the rgb data since it's conveniently available. 

I'm ok with making `DepthCameraSensor` only output grayscale images.
content.html:
ha ya initially I manually converted depth data to gray scale image inside ign-sensors DepthCameraSensor but reverted it to just use the rgb data since it's conveniently available.

I'm ok with making DepthCameraSensor only output grayscale images.

pullrequest.title: Update depth and rgbd camera sensor to output point cloud data generated by ign-rendering DepthCamera

content.raw: Ideally, a depth camera wouldn't have `rgb`. Is it too hard to filter that out from the scans on `OnNewRgbPointCloud`?
content.html: Ideally, a depth camera wouldn't have rgb. Is it too hard to filter that out from the scans on OnNewRgbPointCloud?

content.raw:
This is a trully high-quality depth camera, it even has color points like an RGBD camera :sweat_smile:

![Screenshot from 2019-08-15 14-47-27.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/4113398019-Screenshot_from_2019-08-15_14-47-27.png)

This is using https://github.com/osrf/ros1_ign/pull/39
content.html:
This is a trully high-quality depth camera, it even has color points like an RGBD camera
